article.headline: N.J. Tech 59, Longwood 55
article.story: NEWARK, N.J. (AP) -- Clayton Barker scored 13 points -- one of four New Jersey Institute of Technology players in double figures -- and the Highlanders broke a 13-game losing streak with a 59-55 win over Longwood on Wednesday night. Kraig Peters added 11 points and Andrew Engel and Nesho Milosevic added 10 each for NJIT, which is in its first year of Division I competition. Maurice Sumter went 10-for-18 from the floor and finished with a game-high 25 points for Longwood (6-13), which hit just 34.5 percent of its shots. The Highlanders (3-13) were in command for most of the game but had trouble putting away the Lancers, who closed the game with a 10-4 run. NJIT, though, sealed the win by going 6-for-7 from the free throw line in the final two minutes.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
